name: Harborhaven
economy_niches: pilotage, harbor dues and navigational services
artisan metalwork for rigging and fittings
culture_adjustments: harbor-clans hold greater legal autonomy than inland kin-groups
practical syncretism emphasizes pilot rites over temple arbitration
apprenticeship and guild oath-taking outrank birth-status in ports
public festivals center on launches, salting seasons and tidal rites
constraints: ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents
navigational auguries complement but do not replace charts
notes: pilot rites function as informal licensing and control of pilots
salt works double as primary local reagent sources for ritualists
state depends on Harborhaven for winter provisioning and ship repair
